newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London nudge up in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London nudge up in quiet trade.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks in Londonwere lifted by gains by the FTSE and Dow on Friday but worries about whether the U.S. bull run would last kept many investors out of the market, traders said.

The Hang Seng Reference Index was up 46.29 points, or 0.35 percent, at 13,368.08 by 1515 GMT. "The market is riding up on the FTSE and Wall Street," one trader said. "But people are concerned about whether Wall Street can sustain its rise."
The banking sector showed some buying interest with HSBC Holdings attracting the most attention.
Traders said they were expecting a quiet week ahead with national holidays in Hong Kong on Thusday and Friday to celebrate the Chinese New Year.
In Hong Kong earlier, the Hang Seng Index rose 33.39 points to 13,321.79.
